critique: This document pertains to the withdrawal of public lands in Colorado from settlement, location, sale, entry, and all forms of appropriation pending a resurvey. It cites specific acts of Congress as its authority. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power expansion, or impacts on national security vs. civil liberties. The action seems neutral regarding economic regulation and social inclusion. The federal government is exerting its control over federal lands, so it leans towards federal primacy.
